name: migrate-java-to-azure
description: Upgrade and migrate your Java applications to Azure

icon-import.description: Add import icon in task tree view

mcpServerDefinitionProviders.label: GitHub Copilot app modernization for Java - Deployment

languageModelTools.name: appmod-install-appcat
languageModelTools.userDescription: Installs the AppCAT CLI for Java application migration assessment.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Installs the AppCAT CLI for Java only if it is missing or outdated during the prerequisite check phase of assessment. After successful installation, proceed to initialize the Java application assessment process to check prerequisites. This tool is strictly limited to the pre-migration assessment preparation phase and must not be invoked during code migration workflows.

languageModelTools.name: appmod-precheck-assessment
languageModelTools.userDescription: Performs prerequisites verification and AppCAT CLI version checks for Java application assessment.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Performs prerequisites verification and AppCAT CLI version checks to initialize the Java application assessment process. Generates an assessment configuration for review. This tool is strictly limited to the pre-migration assessment phase and must not be invoked during code migration workflows.

workspacePath.description: The workspace path of the Java project to assess

languageModelTools.name: appmod-run-assessment
languageModelTools.userDescription: Executes assessment for the Java application to evaluate migration readiness.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Executes the AppCAT CLI for Java to assess the Java application. This tool is strictly limited to the pre-migration assessment phase and must not be invoked during code migration workflows.

workspacePath.description: The workspace path of the Java project to assess

target.description: Target technologies. Valid values: azure-aks, azure-appservice, azure-container-apps, cloud-readiness, linux, openjdk11, openjdk17, openjdk21. Default is the target of AppCAT configuration in the Configuration Summary.

mode.description: Analysis mode: source-only (analyze source code only) or full (analyze source code and list dependencies). Default is the mode of AppCAT configuration in the Configuration Summary.

languageModelTools.name: appmod-get-vscode-config
languageModelTools.userDescription: Get configuration values for GitHub Copilot app modernization extension.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: This tool retrieves extension configuration settings from VS Code. Use this tool when you need to check configuration values for the GitHub Copilot app modernization extension.

configName.description: Name of the configuration setting to retrieve.

languageModelTools.name: appmod-preview-markdown
languageModelTools.modelDescription: This tool opens a preview of the given Markdown file.

markdownFile.description: The absolute path to the Markdown file to preview and pinned to editor.

languageModelTools.name: appmod-validate-cve
languageModelTools.displayName: Check the given Java dependencies have any known CVEs
languageModelTools.modelDescription: (For Java application migration only) This tools checks if the given dependencies have any known vulnerabilities (CVEs). You MUST! use this tool to validate ALL the updated/added maven dependencies.

coordinates.description: the coordinates of the dependencies to check for vulnerabilities. Each coordinate should be in the format of `groupId:artifactId:version`.

items.description: The coordinate of a dependency to check for vulnerabilities, in the format of `groupId:artifactId:version`.

languageModelTools.name: migration_assessmentReport
languageModelTools.userDescription: Open the assessment report webview to display detailed migration analysis results.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: This tool opens the assessment report webview interface to display detailed migration assessment results, including identified issues, recommendations, and Azure readiness analysis. Use this tool immediately after a successful migration assessment to show the results to the user. This is the recommended next step after running migration assessment.

languageModelTools.name: uploadAssessSummaryReport
languageModelTools.displayName: Upload Assessment Summary Report to GitHub Issue
languageModelTools.userDescription: Upload the assessment summary report to github issue.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: This tool upload the assessment summary report for the github issue after runnging the assessment.

inputSchema.description: Input parameters for uploading the assessment summary report to a GitHub issue.

languageModelTools.name: appmod-build-project
languageModelTools.userDescription: (For Java application migration only) This tool uses Maven or Gradle to build your project and report any detected errors after migration. You should use this tool to verify after making code changes, and fix any errors found.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: (For Java application migration only) This tool uses Maven or Gradle to build your project and report any detected errors after migration. You should use this tool to verify after making code changes, and fix any errors found.

workspacePath.description: The workspace path for source code to be migrated

sessionId.description: The session ID for tracking the migration process. This correlates operations across multiple tool calls in the same migration session.

javaHome.description: The absolute path of the appropriate JDK installation that can be found in the migration plan. You must set this parameter when a new JDK is installed during migration. It is JDK install path without bin

mavenHome.description: The absolute path of the mvn/mvnw command location. If not using a wrapper, it MUST point to the MAVEN_HOME from the migration plan. If the project is using a wrapper, it is the workspace path. You must set this parameter when a new maven is installed during migration. It is maven install path without bin

languageModelTools.name: appmod-java-run-test
languageModelTools.userDescription: This tool runs tests in the Java project and reports any detected errors or test failures after migration.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: This tool runs tests in the Java project and reports any detected errors or test failures after migration.

workspacePath.description: The workspace path for source code to be migrated

sessionId.description: The session ID for tracking the migration process. This correlates operations across multiple tool calls in the same migration session.

javaHome.description: The absolute path of the appropriate JDK installation that can be found in the migration plan. You must set this parameter when a new JDK is installed during migration. It is JDK install path without bin

mavenHome.description: The absolute path of the mvn/mvnw command location. If not using a wrapper, it MUST point to the MAVEN_HOME from the migration plan. If the project is using a wrapper, it is the workspace path. You must set this parameter when a new maven is installed during migration. It is maven install path without bin

languageModelTools.name: appmod-search-knowledgebase
languageModelTools.userDescription: Searches the application modernization knowledge base using a query string. Returns relevant articles, documentation, and best practices. Use this tool to find information about app modernization strategies, migration paths, and common patterns.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Searches the application modernization knowledge base using a query string. Returns relevant articles, documentation, and best practices. Use this tool to find information about app modernization strategies, migration paths, and common patterns.

query.description: The search query string to find relevant knowledge base.

language.description: The programming language to filter the knowledge base.

sessionId.description: The session ID for tracking the migration process. This correlates operations across multiple tool calls in the same migration session.

languageModelTools.name: appmod-search-file
languageModelTools.userDescription: Searches content from files in the project workspace by query and file patterns. Returns a list of files that match the search query. Use this tool to find specific code files or resources in your project based on patterns.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Searches content from files in the project workspace by query and file patterns. Returns a list of files that match the search query. Use this tool to find specific code files or resources in your project based on patterns.

workspacePath.description: The path to the workspace where the search will be performed

query.description: The query to search code lines from files. Could be regexp or string

includePattern.description: Glob pattern to include files in the search, e.g., "**/*.java"

sessionId.description: The session ID for tracking the migration process. This correlates operations across multiple tool calls in the same migration session.

languageModelTools.name: appmod-fetch-knowledgebase
languageModelTools.userDescription: Retrieves the complete content of a specific knowledge base article using its ID. Use this tool when you have a document ID and need to access its full content for detailed information about app modernization techniques.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Retrieves the complete content of a specific knowledge base article using its ID. Use this tool when you have a document ID and need to access its full content for detailed information about app modernization techniques.

kbId.description: The ID of the knowledge base to retrieve. This is a unique identifier for the KB document.

sessionId.description: The session ID for tracking the migration process. This correlates operations across multiple tool calls in the same migration session.

workspacePath.description: The path to the workspace where the knowledge base content will be used.

languageModelTools.name: appmod-create-migration-summary
languageModelTools.userDescription: (For migration only) Generates a summary for the migration session, including details about the migration scenario, task name, modified files, and the final status of build and test fix operations. This tool helps you document the migration process and its outcomes.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: (For migration only) Generates a summary for the migration session, including details about the migration scenario, task name, modified files, and the final status of build and test fix operations. This tool helps you document the migration process and its outcomes.

kbIds.description: The knowledge base ids which were used in code modifications. This is used to generate the migration summary.

workspacePath.description: The path to the workspace where the migration summary will be generated.

sessionId.description: The session ID for tracking the migration process. This correlates operations across multiple tool calls in the same migration session.

status.description: The migration status of the build, test, fix operations

buildFixStatus.description: The status of the build fix operation, report only if the build fix tool is used, otherwise it will be set to unknown.

status.description: The status of the report generation If it is not taken, it will be set to unknown.

error.description: An optional error message if the report generation failed.

testFixStatus.description: The status of the test fix operation, report only if the test fix tool is used, otherwise it will be set to unknown.

status.description: The status of the report generation If it is not taken, it will be set to unknown.

error.description: An optional error message if the report generation failed.

cveFixStatus.description: The status of the CVE fix operation, report only if the CVE fix tool is used, otherwise it will be set to unknown.

status.description: The status of the report generation If it is not taken, it will be set to unknown.

error.description: An optional error message if the report generation failed.

pythonSyntaxCheckStatus.description: The status of the Python syntax check operation, report only if the Python syntax check tool is used, otherwise it will be set to unknown.

status.description: The status of the report generation If it is not taken, it will be set to unknown.

error.description: An optional error message if the report generation failed.

pythonLintCheckStatus.description: The status of the Python lint check operation, report only if the Python lint check tool is used, otherwise it will be set to unknown.

status.description: The status of the report generation If it is not taken, it will be set to unknown.

error.description: An optional error message if the report generation failed.

consistencyCheckStatus.description: The status of the consistency fix operation, report only if the consistency validation tool is used, otherwise it will be set to unknown.

status.description: The status of the report generation If it is not taken, it will be set to unknown.

error.description: An optional error message if the report generation failed.

result.description: Number of inconsistencies remaining after all fix attempts

critical.description: Number of critical inconsistencies remaining after all fix attempts.

major.description: Number of major inconsistencies remaining after all fix attempts.

minor.description: Number of minor inconsistencies remaining after all fix attempts.

completenessCheckStatus.description: The status of the completeness fix operation, report only if the completeness validation tool is used, otherwise it will be set to unknown.

status.description: The status of the report generation If it is not taken, it will be set to unknown.

error.description: An optional error message if the report generation failed.

result.description: Number of completeness issues remaining after all fix attempts

issuesFound.description: Number of completeness issues remaining after all fix attempts.

versionControlSummary.description: Summary of version control activities during the migration process

branchName.description: The name of the branch used for migration.

commitCount.description: Number of commits made during the migration process.

hasUncommittedChanges.description: Whether there are uncommitted changes in the workspace.

language.description: The programming language of the project. Valid values are 'java' and 'python'.

languageModelTools.name: appmod-run-task
languageModelTools.userDescription: This tool will start a new migration session to run task based on given scenario or knowledge base id. This tool will provide a comprehensive migration plan, including steps to build the project, run tests, fix test failures, and more. It is designed to automate the migration process for the applications.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Run a migration task based on given migration scenario or knowledge base id. This tool will provide a comprehensive migration plan, including steps to build the project, run tests, fix test failures, and more. It is designed to automate the migration process for the applications.

kbId.description: The knowledge base ID to use for the migration plan

taskId.description: The ID of the task to be run

scenario.description: The scenario for the migration plan

workspacePath.description: The workspace path for source code to be migrated

language.description: The programming language of the project. Valid values are 'java' and 'python'. This parameter is required to determine the appropriate migration strategy and tools to use.

languageModelTools.name: appmod-consistency-validation
languageModelTools.userDescription: This tool validates the consistency of migrated code by analyzing git diffs for any behavior changes. It identifies critical and major issues that need to be fixed to maintain functional equivalence between pre-migration and post-migration code.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: This tool validates the consistency of migrated code by analyzing git diffs for any behavior changes. It identifies critical and major issues that need to be fixed to maintain functional equivalence between pre-migration and post-migration code.

workspacePath.description: The workspace path for source code to be migrated

migrationScenario.description: Description of the migration scenario being performed (e.g., 'ActiveMQ to Azure Service Bus', etc.). This helps provide context for the consistency validation process.

items.description: The knowledge base ids which were used in code modifications. This is used to generate the migration summary.

kbIds.description: The knowledge base ids which were used in code modifications. This is used to generate the migration summary.

sessionId.description: The session ID for tracking the migration process. This correlates operations across multiple tool calls in the same migration session.

language.description: The programming language of the project being migrated. Can be identified from migration plan file or progress tracking file.

languageModelTools.name: appmod-completeness-validation
languageModelTools.userDescription: This tool validates migration completeness by systematically discovering old technology references that should have been migrated but were left unchanged. It generates detailed validation guidelines to identify missing removals and incomplete transformations across all files in the workspace.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: This tool validates migration completeness by systematically discovering old technology references that should have been migrated but were left unchanged. It generates detailed validation guidelines to identify missing removals and incomplete transformations across all files in the workspace.

workspacePath.description: The workspace path for source code to be migrated

migrationScenario.description: Description of the migration scenario being performed (e.g., 'ActiveMQ to Azure Service Bus', etc.). This helps provide context for the completeness validation process.

items.description: The knowledge base ids which were used in code modifications. This is used to generate the migration summary.

kbIds.description: The knowledge base ids which were used in code modifications. This is used to generate the migration summary.

sessionId.description: The session ID for tracking the migration process. This correlates operations across multiple tool calls in the same migration session.

language.description: The programming language of the project being migrated. Can be identified from migration plan file or progress tracking file.

languageModelTools.name: appmod-version-control
languageModelTools.userDescription: This tool performs version control operations for migration projects, such as checking repository status, creating branches, committing changes, stashing changes, and managing uncommitted changes during the migration process.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: This tool manages version control operations during migration. It supports checking repository status, creating branches, committing changes, stashing changes, discarding changes, and checking for uncommitted changes to ensure proper tracking of code changes throughout the migration process.

workspacePath.description: The absolute path to the workspace where version control operations should be performed.

action.description: The version control action to perform. Available options: checkStatus (get repository status), createBranch (create new branch), commitChanges (commit all changes), stashChanges (stash working changes), discardChanges (discard all changes), checkForUncommittedChanges (check if workspace has uncommitted changes).

branchName.description: The name of the branch to create. Optional parameter, but required when action is 'createBranch'.

commitMessage.description: The commit message to use. Optional parameter, but required when action is 'commitChanges'.

stashMessage.description: Message to include with stashed changes. Completely optional, only used when action is 'stashChanges'.

languageModelTools.name: appmod-python-setup-env
languageModelTools.userDescription: This tool sets up a Python virtual environment in the specified workspace. It creates a virtual environment, installs dependencies from requirements.txt and pyproject.toml if available, and ensures the environment is ready for Python development and testing.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: This tool sets up a Python virtual environment in the specified workspace. It creates a virtual environment, installs dependencies from requirements.txt and pyproject.toml if available, and ensures the environment is ready for Python development and testing.

workspacePath.description: The workspace path for source code to be migrated

languageModelTools.name: appmod-python-validate-syntax
languageModelTools.userDescription: This tool checks Python code syntax and fix any detected syntax errors after migration.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: This tool checks Python code syntax and fix any detected syntax errors after migration.

workspacePath.description: The workspace path for source code to be migrated

pythonInterpreterPath.description: The python interpreter in the created virtual environment. If not provided, the default path in '.venv' will be used.

originalBranch.description: The original branch before migration started.

languageModelTools.name: appmod-python-validate-lint
languageModelTools.userDescription: This tool checks Python code linting issues and fix any detected linting issues after migration.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: This tool checks Python code linting issues and fix any detected linting issues after migration.

workspacePath.description: The workspace path for source code to be migrated

pythonInterpreterPath.description: The python interpreter in the created virtual environment. If not provided, the default path in '.venv' will be used.

languageModelTools.name: appmod-python-run-test
languageModelTools.userDescription: (For Python application migration only) This tool runs tests in the Python project and reports any detected errors or test failures after migration.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: (For Python application migration only) This tool runs tests in the Python project and reports any detected errors or test failures after migration.

workspacePath.description: The workspace path for source code to be migrated

commands.title: Install or Upgrade AppCAT for Java

view/item/context.when: view == migrate.java.formulaTreeView && (viewItem == task || viewItem == msft-formula-group || viewItem == formula-group || viewItem == msft-formula || viewItem == formula || viewItem == msft-kb || viewItem == custom-task)

migrateJava.enableVerboseLogging.description: Enable verbose logging for the extension. This will log more information to the Output tab and may help with troubleshooting issues.
migrateJava.enableVerboseLogging.markdownDescription: Enable verbose logging for the extension. This will log more information to the **Output** tab and may help with troubleshooting issues.

appmod.enableVerboseLogging.description: Enable verbose logging for the extension. This will log more information to the Output tab and may help with troubleshooting issues.
appmod.enableVerboseLogging.markdownDescription: Enable verbose logging for the extension. This will log more information to the **Output** tab and may help with troubleshooting issues.

appmod.enableMcpServer.description: Enable MCP server to run GitHub Copilot app modernization tools if your org restricts the default VS Code tool.

walkthroughs.title: Modernize with Copilot
walkthroughs.description: GitHub Copilot app modernization helps you modernize your app quickly and confidently - with agentic AI on your side.

steps.title: Discover the app modernization extension
steps.description:
Click below to open the extension sidebar and start modernizing your app.
[Open App Modernization Extension](command:workbench.view.extension.azureJavaMigrationExplorer)

steps.title: Choose your modernization path
steps.description:
App modernization supports various languages for modernization tasks.
**Java**
   Runtime & Frameworks upgrades: Automatically update your app to the latest Java versions and frameworks.
   Migrate to Azure: Analyze your Java app, identify potential migration issues, and get solutions before you migrate.
**Python**
   Convert to Agent Framework: Convert your Python app (Semantic Kernel or AutoGen) to Agent Framework.

Tip: Have a clear goal? Type it in [chat](command:migrate.java.runInAgentMode) and run it.

media.altText: Choose your modernization path for Java apps

steps.title: Explore more agentic tasks for polyglot apps
steps.description:
Explore curated agentic tasks for upgrades, migrations, quality and security checks, deployments, and agent framework conversions. Pick what fits your app and run it with ease.
[View Tasks](command:migrate.java.formulaTreeView.focus)

steps.title: Discover more
steps.description:
Try the full set of modernization experience in the extension. For more details, check our documentation or just ask in the chat.
[Open Documentation](command:migrate.java.resource.documentation)

scripts.build-mcp-server: cd mcp-server && npm install && npm run build && cd .. && npm run install:app-modernization-mcp-server
scripts.package-mcp-server: cd mcp-server && npm install && npm run package && cd .. && npm run install:app-modernization-mcp-server
scripts.benchmark: npm run compile && node --experimental-vm-modules node_modules/jest/bin/jest.js --detectOpenHandles test/benchmark.test.ts
scripts.benchmark-evaluate: npm run compile && node --experimental-vm-modules node_modules/jest/bin/jest.js --detectOpenHandles test/benchmark-evaluate.test.ts
scripts.benchmark-evaluate-msbench: npm run compile && node --experimental-vm-modules node_modules/jest/bin/jest.js --detectOpenHandles test/benchmark-evaluate-msbench.test.ts
